RelatedSentence: Convicted trader Jerome Kerviel was arrested in southern France late on Sunday to serve a three - year jail sentence in a high - profile case he has depicted as one individual 's struggle against high finance .
Kerviel , 37 , has spent years fighting charges stemming from massive market bets that brought French bank Societe Generale SA close to collapse in 2008 .

For weeks , the former trader had been marching to Paris from Rome where he met Pope Francis earlier this year , in protest against the tyranny of financial markets .
He had been followed by a crowd of reporters and live television crews .
French judges required him to report to a French police station by midnight yesterday to start serving his sentence , which was confirmed by France 's highest appeals court in March .

In March , France 's highest appeal court upheld his three - year jail term , but it quashed 4.9 billion euros in civil damages that judges had ordered Kerviel to pay to compensate Societe Generale for its losses when the bank unwound the trader 's positions during the financial crisis .
